div.p:
The Tinkar Reference Model is a logical model that describes the standardized model for terminology and change management, previously published in the HL7 Logical Model: Standardized Terminology Knowledgebase, Release 1. Tinkar provides an architecture that delivers integrated terminology to the enterprise and its information systems.
It was designed to support the healthcare enterprise need for an extensive terminology foundation and the ability to implement extensions to support diverse informatics systems. It supports standard terminology modules, value sets, and coding systems as well as local terms and equivalence mappings.
In this edition, standardized data exchange formats and transactions are defined to specifically enable the exchange Tinkar-compliant Terminology change sets, both in a lossless Protobuf format, as well as utilizing FHIR CodeSystem and Provenance resources.
